predicate.note: Frames file for 'relieve' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

role.descr: thing being helped, eased, gotten rid of

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: Ports in the Great Lakes and Atlantic Coast can also relieve pressure on New Orleans.
example.arg: Ports in the Great Lakes and Atlantic Coast

example.name: benefactive: relieve of
example.text: Mr. Wall relieved them of responsibility for supervising Lincoln in 1988.

example.name: prepositional arg0
example.text: With investors relieved at the overnight gain in New York stocks, small-lot buying orders streamed into the market from early morning, making traders believe the market was back to normal.
example.arg: the overnight gain in New York stocks

example.name: more normal arg0
example.text: And some commuters, relieved *trace* by the absence of gridlock, were planning to return to their old ways.

example.name: sentential arg0
example.text: Around Wall Street, trading desks were relieved *trace* that they could at least play the market yesterday, in contrast to Friday's gridlock.
example.arg: that they could at least play the market yesterday, in contrast to Friday's gridlock
example.note: Note that here the complementizer is mandatory!

predicate.note: In the absence of arg2 the two rolesets might be easy to confuse although they are semantically quite distinct.
